name: Sarwar
text: Sad. I swear by the Quran, which is full of reminders of God, (that you are a Messenger).

name: Sarwar
text: In fact, the unbelievers are the ones who are boastful and quarrelsome.

name: Sarwar
text: How many ancient generations did We destroy? (On facing Our torment) they cried out for help, but it was too late for them to escape.

name: Sarwar
text: It seems strange to the pagans that a man from their own people should come to them as a Prophet. The unbelievers have said, "He is only a lying magician".

name: Sarwar
text: They say, "Has he condemned all other gods but One? This is certainly strange".

name: Sarwar
text: A group of the pagans walked out of a meeting with the Prophet and told the others, "Let us walk away. Be steadfast in the worship of your gods. This man wants to dominate you.

name: Sarwar
text: We have heard nothing like this in the latest religion. This is only his own false invention.

name: Sarwar
text: Can it be that he alone has received the Quran?" In fact, they have doubts about My Quran and this is because they have not yet faced (My) torment.

name: Sarwar
text: Do they possess the treasures of the mercy of your, (Muhammad's), Lord, the Majestic and Munificent God?

name: Sarwar
text: Do they own the heavens and the earth and all that is between them? Let them try on their own to block (the ways of heavens so that Our revelations cannot come to you).

name: Sarwar
text: They are only a small band among the defeated confederate tribes.

name: Sarwar
text: The people of Noah, Ad and the dominating Pharaoh had rejected Our revelations.

name: Sarwar
text: So also did the people of Thamud, Lot, and the dwellers of the Forest.

name: Sarwar
text: Each of them who rejected the Messenger become subject to Our punishment.

name: Sarwar
text: They had only to wait for the single inevitable blast.

name: Sarwar
text: They scornfully said, "Lord, show us the record of our deeds before the day when everyone must present the account of their deeds.".

name: Sarwar
text: (Muhammad), bear patiently what they say and recall Our servant, David, who had strong hands and who was most repentant.

name: Sarwar
text: We made the mountains join him in glorifying Us in the evening and in the morning.

name: Sarwar
text: We made the birds assemble around him in flocks.

name: Sarwar
text: We strengthened his kingdom, giving him wisdom and the power of sound Judgment.

name: Sarwar
text: Have you heard the news of the disputing parties who climbed the walls of the prayer room

name: Sarwar
text: and entered where David was (praying). He was frightened, so they said, "Do not be afraid. We are only two disputing parties of which one of us has transgressed against the other. Judge between us with truth and justice and guide us to the right path".

name: Sarwar
text: One of them said, "This is my brother who has ninety-nine ewes when I have only one. He has demanded me to place that one in his custody; he had the stronger argument".

name: Sarwar
text: David said, "He has certainly been unjust in demanding your ewe from you. Most partners transgress against each other except for the righteously striving believers who are very few." David realized that it was a test from Us so he asked forgiveness from his Lord and knelt down before him in repentance.

name: Sarwar
text: We forgave him for this. In Our eyes he certainly has a good position and the best share (of the world to come).

name: Sarwar
text: We told him. "David, We have appointed you as Our deputy on earth so judge among the people with truth. Do not follow (worldly) desires lest you go astray from the way of God. Those who go astray from the way of God will suffer severe torment for forgetting the Day of Reckoning.

name: Sarwar
text: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them without purpose, even though this is the belief of the disbelievers. Woe to the disbelievers; they will suffer the torment of fire

name: Sarwar
text: Do We consider the righteously striving believers equal to the evil-doers in the land? Are the pious ones equal to those who openly commit sin?

name: Sarwar
text: It is a blessed Book which We have revealed for you so that you will reflect upon its verses and so the people of understanding will take heed.

name: Sarwar
text: We granted Solomon to David, a blessed servant of Ours and certainly the most repentant person.

name: Sarwar
text: When the noble galloping horses were displayed to him one evening,

name: Sarwar
text: he said, "My love of horses for the cause of God has made me continue watching them until sunset, thus making me miss my prayer".

name: Sarwar
text: He said, "Bring them back to me." Then he started to rub their legs and necks.

name: Sarwar
text: We tested Solomon by (causing death to his son) and leaving his body on Solomon's chair. Then he turned to Us in repentance,

name: Sarwar
text: saying, "Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom that no one after me can have the like. You are All-munificent".

name: Sarwar
text: We made the wind subservient to him, to blow gently wherever he desired at his command

name: Sarwar
text: and all the devils who built and dived for him.

name: Sarwar
text: The rest of the devils were bound in chains.

name: Sarwar
text: We told him, "This is Our gift to you so give them away free or keep them as you like".

name: Sarwar
text: In Our eyes he certainly has a high position and the best place to return.

name: Sarwar
text: (Muhammad), recall Our servant Job. When he prayed to his Lord saying, "Satan has afflicted me with hardship and torment,"

name: Sarwar
text: (We answered his prayer, healed his sickness, and told him), "Run on your feet. This is cool water (for you) to wash and drink".

name: Sarwar
text: We gave him back his family and doubled their number as a blessing from Us and as a reminder to the people of understanding.

name: Sarwar
text: We told him, "Take a handful of straw. Strike your wife with it to fulfill your oath." We found him to be patient. What an excellent servant he was. He was certainly most repenting.

name: Sarwar
text: (Muhammad), recall Our servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, all of whom possessed virtuous hands and clear visions.

name: Sarwar
text: We gave them this pure distinction because of their continual remembrance of the Day of Judgment.

name: Sarwar
text: In Our eyes they were of the chosen, virtuous people.

name: Sarwar
text: Recall Ismael, Elisha, and Dhulkifl (Ezekiel) who were all virtuous people.

name: Sarwar
text: Such is their noble story. The pious ones will certainly have the best place to return.

name: Sarwar
text: They will enter gardens of Eden with their gates open for them.

name: Sarwar
text: They will be resting therein and will be able to ask for many kinds of fruit and drink.

name: Sarwar
text: They will have bashful wives of equal age with them.

name: Sarwar
text: This is what they had been promised for the Day of Judgment.

name: Sarwar
text: Our provision (for you) will never be exhausted.

name: Sarwar
text: However, the rebellious ones will have the worst place to return.

name: Sarwar
text: They will suffer in hell. What a terrible dwelling!

name: Sarwar
text: (They will be told), "This is your recompense.

name: Sarwar
text: Taste the scalding water, pus, and other putrid things".

name: Sarwar
text: Their leaders will be told, "This band will also be thrown headlong with you into hell." Their leaders will exclaim, "May condemnation fall upon them! Let them suffer the torment of fire".

name: Sarwar
text: Their followers will say, "In fact, it is you who deserve condemnation. It was you who led us to hell, a terrible dwelling".

name: Sarwar
text: They will continue saying, "Lord, double the torment of fire for those who led us into this.

name: Sarwar
text: But why is it that we cannot see men whom we had considered as wicked

name: Sarwar
text: and whom we mocked? Have they been rescued or can our eyes not find them?"

name: Sarwar
text: Such disputes will certainly take place among the dwellers of hell fire.

name: Sarwar
text: (Muhammad) say, "I am only a warner. The only Lord is God, the Almighty.

name: Sarwar
text: He is the Lord of the heavens, the earth, and all that is between them, the Majestic and All-forgiving".

name: Sarwar
text: Say, "It (facts about the supremacy of God) is the greatest message,

name: Sarwar
text: but you have turned away from it.

name: Sarwar
text: I have no knowledge of the dispute among the angels (concerning their attitude towards Adam).

name: Sarwar
text: I have only received revelation to give you plain warning.

name: Sarwar
text: When your Lord told the angels, "I will create a mortal out of clay,

name: Sarwar
text: and when I give it proper shape and blow My spirit into it, bow down in prostration to him,"

name: Sarwar
text: all the angel then prostrated themselves

name: Sarwar
text: except Iblis who puffed himself up with pride and became a disbeliever.

name: Sarwar
text: The Lord said, "Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating before what I have created with My own hands? Was it because of your pride or are you truly exalted?"

name: Sarwar
text: He said, "I am better than him. You have created me from fire and him out of clay".

name: Sarwar
text: The Lord said, "Get out of here. You deserve to be stoned!

name: Sarwar
text: My condemnation will be with you until the Day of Judgment!"

name: Sarwar
text: He said, "Lord, grant me respite until the Day of Resurrection".

name: Sarwar
text: The Lord said, "You will only be given a respite

name: Sarwar
text: for an appointed time".

name: Sarwar
text: He said, "By Your Glory, I shall seduce all of them (children of Adam).

name: Sarwar
text: except Your sincere servants among them".

name: Sarwar
text: The Lord said, "I swear by the Truth - and I speak the Truth -

name: Sarwar
text: that I shall certainly fill hell with you and your followers all together".

name: Sarwar
text: (Muhammad), say, "I do not ask any reward for my preaching to you for I am not a pretender.

name: Sarwar
text: It, (the Quran), is nothing but a reminder to you from the Lord of the Universe.

name: Sarwar
text: You will certainly know its truthfulness after a certain time.
